greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = gcd(n, A079277(n)), a(1) = 1.
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
mathematica: Table[GCD[n, #] &@ If[n <= 2, 1, Module[{k = n - 2, e = Floor@ Log2@ n}, While[PowerMod[n, e, k] != 0, k--]; k]], {n, 117}] (* _Michael De Vlieger_, Apr 26 2017 *)
program: return max(i for i in divisors(n) if core(i) == i)
def a(n): return 1 if n==1 else gcd(n, a079277(n))
print([a(n) for n in range(1, 151)]) # _Indranil Ghosh_, Apr 26 2017
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Apr 26 2017
